text: Psalm 106
Praise to Yahweh for His Faithfulness in Israel’s History
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 106:1 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f* Give thanks to Yahweh, for \add he is\add* good,
for his loyal love \add is\add* forever.
Who can utter the mighty deeds of Yahweh,
\add or\add* proclaim all his praise?
Blessed are \add those who\add* observe justice,
\add he who\add* does righteousness at all times.
Remember me, O Yahweh, when \add you show\add* favor to your people.
Look after me when you deliver,
that \add I\add* may see the good \add done\add* your chosen ones,
to be glad in the joy of your nation,
to glory together with your inheritance.
We have sinned \add along\add* with our ancestors.\f + \fr 106:6 \ft Or “fathers” \f*
We have committed iniquity; we have incurred guilt.
Our ancestors\f + \fr 106:7 \ft Or “fathers” \f* in Egypt did not understand your wonderful works.
They did not remember your many acts of loyal love,
and \add so\add* they rebelled by \add the\add* sea at ⸤the Red Sea⸥.\f + \fr 106:7 \ft Literally “sea of reed” \f*
Yet he saved them for the sake of his name,
to make known his might.
So he rebuked ⸤the Red Sea⸥,\f + \fr 106:9 \ft Literally “sea of reed” \f* and it dried up,
and he led them through the deep as \add through\add* a desert.
Thus he saved them from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* hater
and redeemed them from \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* enemy.
But waters covered their adversaries;
not one of them survived.
Then they believed his words;
they sang his praise.
They quickly forgot his works;
they did not wait for his counsel.
And they ⸤craved intensely⸥\f + \fr 106:14 \ft Literally “craved a craving” \f* in the wilderness,
and tested God in \add the\add* desert.
So he gave to them their request,
but he sent leanness into their souls.\f + \fr 106:15 \ft Hebrew “soul” or “inner self” \f*
And they were jealous of Moses in the camp,
\add and\add* of Aaron, the holy one of Yahweh.
\add The\add* earth opened and swallowed up Dathan,
and it covered over the gang of Abiram.
Also fire burned in their assembly;
\add the\add* flame devoured \add the\add* wicked.
They made a calf at Horeb
and bowed down to a cast image.
And \add so\add* they exchanged their glory
for an image of an ox that eats grass.
They forgot God their Savior,
who had done great things in Egypt,
wonders in the land of Ham,
awesome deeds by ⸤the Red Sea⸥.\f + \fr 106:22 \ft Literally “sea of reed” \f*
So he said he would exterminate them,
had not Moses, his chosen one,
stood in the breach before him,
to reverse his wrath from destroying \add them\add*.
Then they refused the desirable land;
they did not believe his word,
but grumbled in their tents.
They did not obey the voice of Yahweh.
So ⸤he made an oath⸥\f + \fr 106:26 \ft Literally “he lifted his hand,” an act accompanying an oath \f* against them,
to make them drop in the wilderness,
and to disperse\f + \fr 106:27 \ft Or “let drop” \f* their ⸤descendants⸥\f + \fr 106:27 \ft Literally “seed” \f* among the nations
and to scatter them among the lands.
They also attached themselves to Baal of Peor,
and they ate sacrifices offered to \add the\add* dead.\f + \fr 106:28 \ft Hebrew “sacrifices of dead” \f*
Thus they provoked to anger by their deeds,
and a plague broke out among them.
Then Phinehas stood up and intervened,
and \add so\add* the plague was stopped,
and it was reckoned to him as righteousness
⸤throughout all generations⸥.\f + \fr 106:31 \ft Literally “for a generation and a generation” \f*
They also angered \add God\add* at the waters of Meribah,
and it went badly for Moses on account of them,
because they rebelled against his Spirit,\f + \fr 106:33 \ft A slightly different verbal form yields “they embittered his spirit” \f*
and he spoke thoughtlessly with his lips.
They did not exterminate the peoples,
as Yahweh had commanded them, \f + \fr 106:34 \ft Hebrew “said to them” \f*
but they mingled with the nations
and learned their works,
and served their idols,
which became\f + \fr 106:36 \ft Hebrew “and they became” \f* a snare to them.
They even sacrificed their sons and daughters
to the demons,
and they poured out innocent blood,
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
and \add so\add* the land was defiled with the blood.\f + \fr 106:38 \ft Hebrew “bloods,” that is, bloodshed \f*
And they became unclean by their works,
and were unfaithful in their deeds.
So Yahweh’s anger burned against his people,
and he abhorred his inheritance.
Then he gave them into \add the\add* hand of \add the\add* nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.
And their enemies oppressed them,
and they were subdued under their hand.
Many times he delivered them,
but they rebelled in their counsel,
and were brought low by their iniquity.
Yet he looked upon their distress
when he heard their cry.
And he remembered his covenant with them,
and relented based on the abundance of his loyal love.
And he ⸤let them find compassion⸥\f + \fr 106:46 \ft Literally “gave them to \fq have \ft mercies” \f*
before all their captors.
Save us, O Yahweh our God,
and gather us from the nations,
so that \add we may\add* give thanks to your holy name
\add and\add* boast in your praise.
Blessed \add is\add* Yahweh, the God of Israel,
from everlasting and to everlasting.
And let all the people say, “Amen!”
Praise Yah.\f + \fr 106:48 \ft Hebrew \fqa hallelujah \ft  \f*
